ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: developed my knowledge of spanish by a lot and i was actually interested
Learned more about speaking and writing high level Spanish.
Helped my speaking and writing skills
Learned a lot about Spanish language, culture and speaking skills
I learned a lot about Spanish grammar and culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: it was a fantastic course i loved it
I love this course, solely because of the prof Virginia Santos
Too much work, the attendance policy is too strict, and the work didn't really help me retain things well
I didn't really think there were any weaknesses with the course to be completely honest. I really liked the works (films/readings) we did.
Home assignments could have been reduced
The teaching style was a strength, it could be improved by more in-class discussions of the books.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. But it would not really matter because if someone is taking Spanish, unless they place into L4 orL L5 they have to take L3.
